title: Mount Thompson (Antarctica)
text: Mount Thompson is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a>, high, standing north-west of <a href="Lehrke%20Inlet">Lehrke Inlet</a> and surmounting the central part of the base of <a href="Eielson%20Peninsula">Eielson Peninsula</a>, on the east coast of <a href="Palmer%20Land">Palmer Land</a>. It was discovered by the Ronne Antarctic Research Expedition, 1947–48, under <a href="Finn%20Ronne">Finn Ronne</a>, who named this feature for <a href="Andrew%20A.%20Thompson">Andrew A. Thompson</a>, geophysicist with the expedition.
